content.subheadline: Transform your kitchen with professional design and quality craftsmanship. From $10,000 refreshes to $100,000+ luxury transformations.

left_column.headline: Complete Kitchen Transformation Services
included_services: Design Consultation - Free in-home assessment and planning
Demolition & Prep - Safe removal of existing fixtures and surfaces
Professional Installation - Expert craftsmanship for all components
Plumbing Updates - Sink, dishwasher, and appliance connections
Cabinet Installation - Custom, semi-custom, or refacing options
Countertop Installation - Quartz, granite, marble, and more
Backsplash & Tile Work - Professional installation and design
Flooring Installation - Hardwood, tile, LVP, and other options
Lighting Design - Under-cabinet, recessed, and accent lighting
Final Finishing - Paint, trim, and detail work
Project Management - Single point of contact throughout

right_column.headline: The Top Notch Advantage
advantages: Seamless Integration - Coordinated project management across all trades
Code Compliance - All work meets or exceeds NJ building standards
Cost Efficiency - Direct supplier relationships for better pricing
Timeline Efficiency - Streamlined process for faster completion
Quality Assurance - One contractor responsible for entire project

steps.title: Free Consultation & Design
steps.subtitle: Understanding Your Vision
steps.description: In-home assessment and measurements, discussion of needs, wants, and budget, initial design concepts and layout options, material and finish selections, detailed project timeline, written estimate with no hidden costs

steps.title: Planning & Permits
steps.subtitle: Preparing for Success
steps.description: Finalized design and material orders, permit applications (when required), project scheduling and timeline confirmation, pre-construction meeting, material delivery coordination

steps.title: Demolition & Infrastructure
steps.subtitle: Setting the Foundation
steps.description: Careful demolition and debris removal, professional rough-in work coordination, plumbing rough-in and relocations, structural modifications (if needed), drywall repairs and preparation

steps.title: Installation & Finishing
steps.subtitle: Bringing Your Vision to Life
steps.description: Flooring installation, cabinet installation and adjustment, countertop templating and installation, backsplash and tile work, professional finish work and lighting, plumbing fixture installation, paint and final trim work

steps.title: Final Walkthrough & Warranty
steps.subtitle: Ensuring Your Satisfaction
steps.description: Complete project inspection, functionality testing of all systems, client walkthrough and approval, warranty documentation, care and maintenance instructions, follow-up service scheduling

faqs.question: How long does a kitchen remodel take?
faqs.answer: Timeline depends on project scope: Basic refresh: 2-3 weeks, Mid-range renovation: 4-6 weeks, Luxury transformation: 6-8 weeks, Custom projects: 8-12 weeks. Factors affecting timeline include permit requirements, custom orders, and structural changes.

faqs.question: Do I need permits for my kitchen remodel?
faqs.answer: Permit requirements vary by scope: Cosmetic updates usually need no permits, plumbing changes require permits for relocations, structural changes require building permits. As a licensed contractor, we handle all permit applications and inspections.

faqs.question: Can you work around my schedule?
faqs.answer: We understand kitchen disruption is challenging. We offer flexible scheduling options, weekend work possible (additional cost), phased approach for occupied homes, temporary kitchen setup recommendations, and clear daily cleanup protocols.

faqs.question: What's included in your warranty?
faqs.answer: Comprehensive warranty coverage includes: Workmanship: 2 years on all labor, Installation work: 1 year on all professional installations, Materials: Manufacturer warranties passed through, Cabinets: Varies by manufacturer (typically 1-5 years), Appliances: Full manufacturer warranty support.

faqs.question: How do you handle cost overruns?
faqs.answer: Transparent pricing and change management: Detailed written estimates with line items, change order process for any modifications, no surprise costs or hidden fees, regular communication about any potential changes, client approval required for all additional work.
